subject: RE: [junit] JSP taglib for running tests?
msgSnippet: Hi Peter, Cactus can do what you re looking for. You can check: http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/writing/howto_jsp.html If you need more details, please post
messageBody:
Hi Peter,

Cactus can do what you're looking for. You can check:
http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/writing/howto_jsp.html

If you need more details, please post on the Cactus mailing list.

Thanks
-Vincent

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Peter Dobratz [mailto:dobratzp@...]
> Sent: 12 March 2003 17:49
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JSP taglib for running tests?
>
> Hi all,
>
> I'm in the process of writing a JSP application and I would like to
> run unit tests on the server as well as locally. The motivation for
> this is that invariably, you end up running different JVM versions (or
> architectures at least) on the server and locally, which can introduce
> really annoying bugs.
>
> I was thinking of making a custom taglib for running the tests. It
> would be used similarly to the following:
>
> <mylib:test-output>
> <mylib:test-case testClass="mypackage.tests.UserTest" />
> <mylib:test-case testClass="mypackage.tests.DbConnectTest" />
> <mylib:test-case testClass="mypackage.tests.UtilsTest" />
> <mylib:test-suite testClass="mypackage.tests.SomeTests" />
> </mylib:test-output>
>
> This would then print out an HTML table summarizing the results of the
> unit tests and their success or failure.
>
> I've looked around for existing software to suite this functionality,
> but haven't found an exact match. I looked at Cactus
> (http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/), HttpUnit
> (http://httpunit.sourceforge.net/) and TagUnit
> (http://www.tagunit.org/). Have I missed something?
>
> I would appreciate any input.
>
> --Peter
